title: Geometry of numbers
summary: Geometry of numbers is the part of number theory which uses geometry for the study of algebraic numbers. Typically, a ring of algebraic integers is viewed as a lattice in R n , {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n},} and the study of these lattices provides fundamental information on algebraic numbers.[1] The geometry of numbers was initiated by Hermann MinkowskiÂ (1910).
